org.drombler.commons.data

Class DataHandlerRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drombler.commons.data.DataHandlerRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class DataHandlerRegistry
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    A registry for all open data handlers with a non-null unique key.
    Author:
    puce

    • Method Detail

      • registerDataHandler

        public <K,D extends DataHandler<K>> D registerDataHandler(D dataHandler)
        Registers a DataHandler.

        If a data handler is already registered for the unique key, the registered data handler will be returned. Use the returned data handler.

        If the unique key of the data handler is non-null, the data handler is registered immediately. Else the unique key property of the data handler will be observed for changes and once it's non-null, the data handler will be registerd.

        Note: Always work with the returned data handler!
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the unique key of the data handler
        D - the type of the data handler
        Parameters:
        dataHandler - the data handler
        Returns:
        the provided data handler or the already registered data handler for the unique key (which is expected to have the same type), if there is any, or the observed data handler for null unique keys

      • unregisterDataHandler

        public void unregisterDataHandler(DataHandler<?> dataHandler)
        Unregisters a DataHandler.
        Parameters:
        dataHandler - the data handler to unregister

      • containsDataHandlerForUniqueKey

        public <K,D extends DataHandler<K>> boolean containsDataHandlerForUniqueKey(Class<D> type,
                                                                            K uniqueKey)
        Checks if there is a registered DataHandler for the provided unique key.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the unique key of the data handler
        D - the type of the data handler
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the data handler
        uniqueKey - the unique key of the data handler
        Returns:
        true, if this registry contains a data handler for the provided unique key, else false

      • getDataHandler

        public <K,D extends DataHandler<K>> D getDataHandler(Class<D> type,
                                                     K uniqueKey)
        Gets the DataHandler for the provided unique key.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the unique key of the data handler
        D - the type of the data handler
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the data handler
        uniqueKey - the unique key of the data handler
        Returns:
        the data handler for the specified unique key, if there is any, else null
